greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sum(sum(binomial(j-n-1,m),m=0..n),j=0..n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
formula: Differs from A072547 by -1, +1, -1, +1, -1, ... - _Ralf Stephan_, Apr 19 2004
Equals sum(m=0, n, (-1)^m*binomial(n+m, m)). - _Henry Gould_, Apr 23 2004
Let f(n) = (-1)^n a(n). Then 2f(n) + f(n-1) = (3n+1)C(n) + (-1)^n, where C(n) = (2n+1)!/n!(n+1)! is a Catalan number (A000108). - _Henry Gould_, Apr 24 2004
results.author: Francois Jooste (pin(AT)myway.com), Apr 23 2004
